Key Arguments: The legislation impinges on freedom of speech.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth.
Truth is subjective and can change over time.
Freedom of speech is essential for societal progress and informed decision-making.
There is no need for the bill as misinformation and disinformation do not threaten Australians' safety and well-being.
Australians are capable of making their own decisions without government intervention.
Notable Quotes: The Government is not fit to be the arbiter of what is or is not Truth.
Misinformation and disinformation does not pose any threat to the safety and well being of Australians.
